page.title: 04Horses in Howden-le-Wear(1)
page.content: { {Miss Wakefield}owns a horse farm at the top of{Hargill Hill.}On it she has 6 horses. Her oldest horse is 21 and her youngest is 1. There are no foals. The horses eat quite alot of things like{hay, grass, bran, oats, pony {cubes, chaff, salt or minerals.}The horses like all of their food. Miss Wakefield has 7 fields, she sometimes gives show jumping lessons. Of all her horses the highest one is 16 hands 2. There are no stable boys or girls but there are 2 helpers. Miss Wakefield sometimes enjoys polishing the tack but she doesn't like mucking the stables out. She sometimes gets her horses broken in.{A horse costs Â£600 a {year to feed ; about Â£20 a week. She doesn't sell riding gear. There's a lot of lorries and vans in the drive.
